channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumping outside recycling bins, 16th December
item.description:
Recycling bins are empty / has space but piles of bin bags filled with recycling and rubbish dumped in front and on top of bins. Blocking food waste bin, unclean and unsightly. Encourages additional dumping and mess. Problem for months

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chart Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover clicking at every car, 16th December
item.description:
Since the road markings were redone, the manhole cover has been clicking every time a car passes over it. It’s very loud, especially knowing that 20 to 30 cars can make it click every minute. It’s a nightmare because rooms are on the same side, and there is cars non stop day and night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Crayford Road, Crayford, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping + overgrown hedge, 16th December
item.description:
Bits of bed and a wheelie-bin dumped behind the bus-shelter at the beginning of the Welling Way. Seriously overgrown hedge filling the space between the bus-shelter and the boundary of the house. This area has been a mess for a considerable time and is lowering the tone of the neighbourhood. Please tidy it up by: removing the rubbish; cutting the hedge back to the boundary. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16,16A, Welling Way, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped mattress Not Fixed, 16th December

item.title: Street lights at the entrance of Sam King Walk, 16th December
item.description:
The street lights between Edmund street and Sam King Walk are not working. One is outdated and needs to be removed (number 2207-01). The other has been installed but it never worked. Please make sure it works and remove the old one.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sam King Walk, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: The whole pathway covered in dead leaves, 16th December
item.description:

item.title: Parking and Residential Impact, 16th December
item.description:
Parking & Resident Impact Non-residents leaving vehicles for several days or even weeks without moving. Multiple commercial vans being parked long-term on the street. Residents regularly unable to park near their homes due to long-stay vehicles. Parking pressure expected to worsen as new Sydenham Hill developments fill up. Safety Concerns Large vans blocking visibility for children and families walking to/from school. Reduced visibility at junctions and driveways due to oversized vehicles. Street Misuse Road increasingly being used as a storage area for non-resident commercial vehicles. Vehicles staying beyond reasonable durations for residential parking. Current school-hours parking restrictions not preventing long-stay occupation. Request to the Council Investigate the issue as it is happening daily and worsening. Assess the street for resident-priority parking measures.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Thorpewood Avenue, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
